slides.title: A. Correct Sitting Posture
slides.description:
The Rule: Sit upright with a straight back, feet flat on the floor, and weight balanced on both buttocks.

Importance: It prevents the stomach and lungs from being compressed, allowing for better digestion and breathing.

Danger: Slumping leads to backaches and permanent deformation of the spine.

slides.title: B. Correct Standing Posture
slides.description:
The Rule: Stand straight with the head up, chin level, and shoulders relaxed but pulled back.

Exam Fact: Good standing posture ensures the vertebral column (backbone) grows in its natural shape and supports weight efficiently.

slides.title: C. Correct Walking Posture
slides.description:
The Rule: Keep the back straight and swing the arms rhythmically.

Exam Fact: This helps maintain body balance and reduces the energy used to move the skeleton.

slides.title: D. Correct Sleeping Posture
slides.description:
The Rule: Sleep on a firm surface (like a firm mattress or a mat) to keep the spine naturally aligned.
Danger: Sleeping on a sagging surface twists the backbone, leading to long-term back pain.
